definitions.example: If you muddy your shoes don't wear them inside.

definitions.definition: To make a mess of, or create confusion with regard to; to muddle.
definitions.example: The discussion only muddied their understanding of the subject.

definitions.definition: Covered with or full of mud or wet soil.
definitions.example: He slogged across the muddy field.

definitions.definition: With mud or other sediment brought into suspension, turbid.
definitions.example: The previously limpid water was now muddy as a result of the epic struggle.

definitions.definition: Not clear; mixed up or blurry.
